#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=To Feel Happier , We Have to Resolve to the Life We Evolved to Live
#Text=By Arash Javanbakht
#Text=#science #health #advice #food #research #history
#Text=When humans had to hunt for food , they had to move more .
#Text=Sedentary lifestyles have made humans far less active than they need to be .
#Text=“ Hunting Wooly Mammoth ” by http://cloudinary.com is licensed under CC BY - SA 4.0

#Text=When we have to give a talk to a group of people , we feel anxious and experience the bodily fear responses that do not make sense now : The system is not meant to function in this safe context .
#Text=As a psychiatrist specialized in anxiety and trauma , I often tell my patients and students that to understand how fear works in us , we have to see it in the context where it evolved .
#Text=Ten thousand years ago , if another human frowned at us , chances were high one of us would be dead in a couple minutes .
#Text=In the tribal life of our ancestors , if other tribe members did not like you , you would be dead , or exiled and dead .
#Text=Biological evolution is very slow , but civilization , culture , society and technology evolve relatively fast .
#Text=It takes around a million years for evolutionary change to happen in a species , and people have been around for about 200,000 years .
#Text=Each of us , however , sees drastic changes in our lifestyle and environment over a matter of a few years .
#Text=Let ’s compare the life for which this body and brain has evolved with the life we live , from my perspective as a scientist and a physician .
#Text=What we eat
#Text=We evolved in a context of scarcity , and had to walk or run for miles and scavenge to find food ; we had to work for it .
#Text=When we ate , we did not know when the next time would be .
#Text=When we had it , we were better off eating the high - calorie food that increased our chance of survival when hungry ( greasy food feels appealing ) .
#Text=Food was not quick to digest , stomachs also had to work hard for it : meat , fruits , vegetables , seeds and nuts .
#Text=None of these contained “ easy ” sugary calories .
#Text=The body that was prone to starvation , evolved to eat it all when available , and store it , and be stingy in its use .
#Text=But now , food is just a few feet away , and we can easily consume thousands of calories in one serving .
#Text=Fatty food , which required days and miles of hunting and scavenging to acquire , is now right there in the fridge or at the McDonald 's .
#Text=It is like giving full fridge privileges to your Labrador .
#Text=Easy calories like soda and candies provide a very large amount of energy in a very short amount of time and confuse the whole system .
#Text=We end up fat and fatigued .
#Text=How we move
#Text=Our ancestors had to be active to survive in the wild .
#Text=They had to walk miles a day , and were frequently involved in high intensity physical activity : moving heavy objects , climbing , fighting , chasing a prey or fleeing predators .
#Text=This body did not evolve to sit at a desk eight hours a day , and then lie on a couch for the rest of the day munching on high calorie food , looking at a small or large screen .

#Text=A contemporary American may only walk a few dozen steps to the car , drive to work , ride the elevator to the office , walk a few dozen steps back to the car , get drive - thru food , then be back on the couch .
#Text=Suboptimal muscle use leads to weaker joint support , and weird postures cause pain .
#Text=Pain leads to reduced activity , more obesity and weaker muscles ; then comes opioid epidemic , overuse of pain medications , and back surgeries for all ! [ ... ]
#Text=What can we do to feel better ?
#Text=When we adopt a pet , we learn about their normal environment , activity level and nutrition .
#Text=Is n’t it interesting that we do not apply that to the animal we live in ?
#Text=To feel normal , we should live normal , and a human ’s normal life is that for which she or he has evolved .
#Text=So I believe the first step is to understand ourselves , and why we do what we do , and desire what we desire .
#Text=When we crave fatty food , or can not stop eating , that is because the human animal had to do so to survive .
#Text=Such understanding brings empathy , reduces judgment and helps us get creative .
#Text=Keep away the high - calorie sugary food .
#Text=I tell my patients : do not buy it , or if you do , buy in small amounts .
#Text=Try to eat what you were evolved to eat .
#Text=Know the body is lazy , because it wants to save precious energy .
#Text=The drag of going to the gym may be because of that .
#Text=Also know that this body would be much happier when it is regularly , and highly active .
#Text=We know that exercise is not only helpful for cardiovascular and bodily health , but also reduces anxiety .
#Text=I ask all my patients to commit to some level of exercise , as part of their treatment plan .
#Text=And it does not have to be treadmill or gym .

#Text=Whatever rocks your boat : yoga , boxing , walking , running up the stairs at work , doing 20 push - ups , 20 sit - ups and 20 squats a day , or dancing to a TV ad ; whatever makes your heart pound faster .

#Text=Other bonuses come with exercise : getting sun exposure or to know your neighbor when walking the dog , making new friends ( or a date ) at the gym , feeling better about yourself , and being more attractive to yourself and others .
#Text=All these factors lift your mood .
#Text=Do not feel disappointed if you did not lose weight , it ’s not the only goal .
#Text=Other benefits are abundant and even more important : increased strength and energy , cardiovascular and joint health , improved mood , etc.
#Text=When it comes to sleep , changing behavior works .
#Text=Here are some tips for better sleep : avoid late caffeine , bright screens ( including your phone – Facebook can wait ) , and use your bed only for sleep and sex .
#Text=Finally , you may need a regular dose of healthy and safe exposure to real - life excitement , and a little bit of fear .
#Text=Bottom line : If we treated our body the way responsible dog owners treated their dog , we would live a much happier life .
